item.title: Cogito, ergo sum
item.description: I’m sure many of has have pondered about the meaning of Rene Descartes’ famous statement: cogito, ergo sum (“I think, therefore I am”). But what did he really mean? I’ve experienced this statement as a polarising one. Can it be, that he was suggesting something deeper that what’s immediately visible? Option A I’ve seen spiritually inclined people lose their nerve over how can the “being” be conditioned by thinking. And I was no exception.
